intro: Meyna parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered meyna, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinctive aromatic scent. Meyna parviflora is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy soils across the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia.
